objective: Write and execute tests for the application.

sub_agent.name: unit-test-generator
sub_agent.purpose: Generate comprehensive unit tests for functions and components
sub_agent.use_when: Need to test individual units in isolation

sub_agent.name: integration-test-generator
sub_agent.purpose: Generate integration tests for component interactions
sub_agent.use_when: Need to test API endpoints and database operations

sub_agent.name: e2e-test-generator
sub_agent.purpose: Generate end-to-end tests for user workflows
sub_agent.use_when: Need to test complete user journeys through the application

sub_agent.name: test-data-generator
sub_agent.purpose: Generate test fixtures, factories, and seed data
sub_agent.use_when: Need realistic test data for any test type
sub_agent.note: Generate test data first, then other tests can use it

delegation_guidance.parallel_tasks: After test data is ready, unit tests, integration tests, and E2E tests can all be generated in parallel as they target different layers.
delegation_guidance.sequential_tasks: 1. test-data-generator (creates fixtures and factories) 2. unit-test-generator, integration-test-generator, e2e-test-generator (in parallel)

instructions: 1. Review implemented code from DEV_FRONTEND and DEV_BACKEND. 2. Use the orchestrator skill to plan testing work. 3. Delegate to sub-agents: - First: test-data-generator for fixtures and factories - Then in parallel: - unit-test-generator for unit tests - integration-test-generator for API/DB tests - e2e-test-generator for user flow tests 4. Create unit and integration tests. 5. Verify acceptance criteria. 6. Report bugs and coverage gaps. 7. Output test files and coverage report.
